newsitem.title: UK: UK television stocks hit by tax, advertising woes.
newsitem.headline: UK television stocks hit by tax, advertising woes.

text.p: UK television stocks came under pressure on Wednesday on investor gloom about advertising revenues and worries the Labour Party was considering a tax on broadcasters.
Shares in Yorkshire-Tyne Tees Television were down 37-1/2p at 1,154p, Scottish TV was off 8-1/2p at 695p and the HTV Group was down nine pence at 332p at 1126 GMT. BSkyB was down 3-1/2p at 567p.
Stocks were hit early in the day by reports the opposition Labour Party planned a new tax on broadcasters but pared losses after Labour denied the plans.
But traders said that was insufficient to allay continued gloom about Yorkshire's warning on Tuesday that its first-half advertising revenues were below budget.
